website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus P-200 can produce beautiful continuous-tone images, but weighing in at almost three pounds, it won't be your constant companion.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: At 28mm its not as sharp as i would've expected it to be(a bit soft, but still great a shot)...you'll have to go low on the f stops to get a sharp image. At 50mm-80mm you'll get sharp shots at almost all f stops. Its girthy, so it looks good on the camera, but its all plastic built. Comes with a 1/2'' hood. I used this as my everyday everywhere lens. Not too worried about it getting damaged. For the price its a great all around lens. Of course there are better lens out there, but for the price this beats them out. I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: MuddyRoots

customer_reviews.title: Better than the SMC 28-80 lens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 7yr old SMC 28-80 lens that just jammed up one day when I really needed it. The Tamron lens is good, autofocuses quite fast and feels well built. I have found that a 28-80 lens is the absolute best balance you can get for 90% of all your photos which is why it's on my camera almost all the time. Basically, this lens works, it's incredible value and the color reproduction doesn't have the tint that my old SMC lens had (which gave the same tint as using Kodak Royal Gold film). As a result of this purchase I'll probably buy another Tamron lens in the future when I want a telephoto lens.
customer_reviews.author: G. D. Fielding

customer_reviews.title: Too good for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is what it is, which is why I gave it 4 stars. It's not a professional lens, but it works perfect for everyday amateur use. Nice focal range 28-80 (equivalent 42-120). Reasonable for anything indoors or fairly close, works as a portrait lens and does well with landscapes and architecture. Great general usage lens and compact as well. The price is really remarkable. I have 8 lenses and this one gets the most use. I have it mounted to a Pentax K20D
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Mediocre is the best way to describe this lens...it does everything ok...but nothing great. It's soft at f/3.5 and also at f/18+...it's best used in the middle around f/11. For a cheap lens it's acceptable, but don't be fooled by 4 or 5 star ratings...you shouldn't expect the same result that you will get with a high end lens.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Tamron Lens
customer_reviews.text: I received this lens two years ago. I use this lens often. Works great with my Pentax D20. It was well worth the price. Product shipped promptly. Wouldn't hesitate to do business with vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: frankkrasz

customer_reviews.title: Great little lens
customer_reviews.text: Got this lens fairly quickly. Takes great pictures and easy to us. Great for regular shots landscapes etc. Good quality all-around camera lens.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Arends

customer_reviews.title: can1 find something better for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: It is really a bargain. The lens is ok, it lacks on a better wide angle end, poor zoom. The pictures it takes are not professional. But colors, sharpness are ok. Best match for short budgets, when you choose Pentax k-01 body.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wlassak

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bargain
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lens at an incredible price! This is really an unbeatable combination. Very sharp lens with good color rendition; an excellent all around lens.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Multi-Purpose
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens on a Pentax Digital and my old ME Super film camera. After purchasing this for the digital I noticed it had the f stop settings so I put it on the ME Super and it works fine in manual mode. The price was right so I got one for each camera.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Chase

customer_reviews.title: Tamron 28-80 lens
customer_reviews.text: The lens is a general use lens. For the money you can't go wrong. The lens is pretty good for portraits and landscape. Works well for close ups as well.
customer_reviews.author: William Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Tamron is Good
customer_reviews.text: Good lens. Good price. It was shipped quickly. I use it as my "walkabout" lens
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Tamron AF 28-80 f/3.5-5.6 for pentax
customer_reviews.text: A good walk around lens for outdoor shoots. AF is a little bit slow. A good buy for its price.
customer_reviews.author: LTB_RAV4

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and lightweight lens.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good all purpose lens for general use. I'd recommend for someone who just need a basic lens and doesn't have much money to spend.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos C. Escudero

product_meta.title: Tamron AF 28-80mm f/3.5-5.6 Aspherical Lens for Pentax Digital SLR Cameras
product_meta.description:
The Tamron AF28-80mm f3.5-f5.6 is a standard zoom lens with a wide to medium telephoto range of 28-80mm, providing great range for nature and landscape photography or snapshots and home photography. By using aspherical elements in the front optical group, Tamron reduced the total number of elements required. They also used strong, engineered plastic for the barrel, making the total lens body only 8.4 ounces. These features make this lens extremely versatile and lightweight. This model is dedicated to Pentax AF SLR cameras.

AMAZON.COM
